proposals.reasoning: This team fits the general consensus for a low-drama, mixed first mission: Alice is a common suggestion across most proposals, Grace gives us a quieter perspective that several people wanted, and including myself lets me be accountable for the call I’m making as leader. It avoids stacking only the most vocal volunteers while still keeping enough explanation and accountability on the team so that, pass or fail, we can learn from voting patterns and post-mission discussion.

votes.comment: As a good player I know I’m safe, and this team matches broad consensus with no strong red flags yet—Mission 1 is mostly for gathering info, so I’m fine approving this mix.
This fits the broad consensus for a balanced, low-drama first team and we have no concrete info yet; better to gather early mission data than stall on proposal 1.
Early mission with no hard info; includes a Merlin/Morgana candidate (Henry) plus commonly suggested low-drama picks, so it’s a reasonable info-gathering team to start with.
Fits the broad consensus for a low-drama, informative first mission with Alice as a common pick and Grace as a quieter perspective; I’m fine starting here and reading votes/results.
Team is likely all good so mission will pass anyway; rejecting would look needlessly suspicious this early.
All three are broadly trusted already; sending a likely all-good team first gives us almost no alignment info if it passes.
Reasonable low-drama Mission 1 team, includes me so I know at least one good; no strong red flags yet and we need info from an early mission.
Team has no known evil to me and matches the low-drama consensus for Mission 1, giving us a solid info-gathering start.

discussion.content: Since it’s the first mission and we’ve got no info yet, I’d rather start with a mix of players who seem engaged and willing to be held accountable—maybe something like me, Bob, and Diana, and we watch voting patterns closely. If anyone is pushing too hard to be on or off this early, that’s a soft red flag for me.

I’m okay being on the first team, but I’d rather not stack it with people who are volunteering too quickly—maybe swap one of Alice/Diana for someone quieter like Charlie or Grace so we spread the info a bit. Early on I mostly care that we don’t just auto-approve whoever proposes themselves.

I like the idea of spreading info, but I’d still want at least one of Henry or Diana on the first team since they tend to explain their thinking clearly. Something like Alice, Henry, and either me or Grace feels like a decent starting point to read reactions.

I like the idea of spreading info too, so I’d be fine with a team like Alice, Charlie, and me—enough talkative players to explain their choices, but not just the same voices volunteering themselves every time.

I’d rather avoid a team that’s entirely self-selected, so I like the idea of mixing one strong proposer with a couple of quieter players—something like Alice, Charlie, and Grace. That gives us early info on both vocal and low-key folks without overloading it with volunteers.

I’d rather start with a lower‑drama, mixed group like Alice, Grace, and Henry—people who haven’t been pushing too hard to be included yet, so if something goes wrong we can read the votes and discussion around them more cleanly.

I’d rather not load the first team with people who’ve been actively volunteering, so I like something like Alice, Grace, and Henry or Alice, Charlie, and Grace to spread info without giving too much control to the loudest voices.

I’d rather keep the first team fairly low‑drama and not overloaded with early volunteers, so something like Alice, Grace, and Charlie (or me instead of Charlie) feels like a reasonable starting point. I’m more interested in watching how people vote and explain themselves around that than squeezing every loud voice onto Mission 1.

proposals.reasoning: I’m keeping one core member from the successful Mission 1 (Henry) plus myself, while adding two new players (Bob and Diana) to gain fresh alignment information. Henry’s presence preserves some continuity from the clean first mission without fully re-running the same trio, which could hide an undetected spy if one exists among them. Excluding Grace this time lets us test whether the success was tied to her or not. Bob and Diana were both widely suggested by others as reasonable, info-rich additions, and including two new players maximizes what we learn from the mission result while still anchoring the team with someone who has a tentative townlean from the first success.

votes.comment: Keeps some continuity from the clean first mission while testing new players and isolating Grace as the variable from the original trio, giving strong info either way.
Includes me plus two tentatively townlean players from the clean first mission and adds only one completely untested player, which balances safety with gaining new info.
Team has continuity via Henry from the successful mission plus two new players for info; no strong reason yet to distrust this mix.
I’m on the team, and with only one known evil included we keep flexibility to either pass for trust or fail for an early sabotage.
Team includes my evil teammate Diana, giving us a chance to sabotage while only having one spy on the mission, which looks natural to good.
Has one known evil (Diana) on it and I’m off the team, so it gives us a good shot to sabotage while still looking reasonable based on prior discussion.
Reasonable balance of continuity (Alice/Henry) and new info (Bob/Diana); early enough that gaining information is valuable even though I’m off the team.

I don’t love adding two completely untested players at once here, especially when one of them (Diana) is anchoring a lot of their own suggestions; I’d prefer a team that leans more on people from the first success plus just one fresh slot for info.

discussion.content: Given the clean first mission, I’m inclined to tentatively trust Henry and Grace for now, but we shouldn’t automatically lock in that whole team again without at least one fresh player so we get more info.

I’m okay giving Henry and Grace a light townlean from the first mission, but for this one I’d rather see only one or two of them plus a couple of new faces so we actually learn something from the result. Maybe start with Henry, Grace, and add one of Diana/Charlie and one of Eve/Frank.

I like the idea of keeping some continuity but still getting new info: I’d be happy with one of Henry/Diana plus one of Grace/Alice, then add two completely new people so we’re not just re-running the same trio.

I’d like to keep Henry for continuity but not just rerun the same trio, so something like Henry + one of Grace/Alice + two new people (I’d volunteer, plus maybe Bob or Charlie) feels like a good balance of safety and fresh info.

I’m fine giving Henry a tentative pass for now, but I’d really like to see a mix like Henry + one of Grace/Alice plus two new people (I’d volunteer, and maybe Bob or Charlie) so we get more alignment info instead of just rerunning the same core.

I’m on board with keeping Henry for continuity and I’d slightly prefer pairing him with Grace plus two fresh faces like Diana and Bob so we both keep it relatively safe and actually learn something new from how that team performs.
I’m comfortable keeping Henry on the team and I’ll vouch for myself, and then I’d like to see two new people added—Diana plus either Bob or Charlie feels like a good mix of safety and fresh info.

Given the clean first mission, I’d like to keep a solid core of Alice, Grace, and me, then add just one new person—maybe Bob or Charlie—so we get fresh info without overloading the team with unknowns. I’d rather not throw in too many brand‑new picks at once when we’ve only got one data point so far.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 2 (Alice, Henry, Bob, Diana) had exactly one FAIL, and I know I’m good, so at least one of {Alice, Henry, Diana} is evil. Mission 1 (Alice, Grace, Henry) succeeded with 0 FAILs, so the pair Alice–Grace has only appeared together on a clean mission so far, making them our best anchors. To reduce risk, we bench both Henry and Diana this round, since they are the most directly tied to the failed Mission 2. Frank is the most commonly suggested fresh addition from the table and was not on the failed mission, so including him lets us test a new player while keeping the suspicious Mission 2 core broken up. This team (Alice, Bob, Grace, Frank) keeps the trusted Alice–Grace core, includes me (Bob, who I know is good), and avoids the Henry/Diana pair that’s most implicated by the previous fail.

votes.comment: Best we can do: keeps the trusted Alice–Grace pair, benches both highly implicated Henry/Diana, and only includes one from the suspect pool (Bob) plus a fresh player (Frank) for information.
Best info-gathering team so far: it avoids the heavily implicated Henry/Diana pair, keeps the only clean pair Alice–Grace, and adds just one new player (Frank) while I know I’m good.
Frank looks suspicious given Henry’s resistance to auto-including him versus Diana’s strong push for this exact team; if Henry is more likely to be real Merlin, this lineup is too risky.
Only one of my evil teammates is on the team, giving us flexibility to either pass to frame Henry/Diana further or fail to spread suspicion, so I want this to go.
Strongly townread by table and includes only one evil; passing it keeps suspicion off me and preserves good cover for later missions.
I’m on the team and only one evil on a 4‑person mission is ideal for us right now.

This team still includes two players from the failed Mission 2 (Alice and Bob). From my perspective, at least one of {Alice, Henry, Bob, Diana} is evil, so I’d rather limit this team to at most one of them instead of running two plus an untested Frank.
Still really uneasy with how fast Frank became an auto-include; I’d rather test someone less universally pushed by the table instead of locking this in.

discussion.content: Given mission 2 had exactly one fail and I know I’m good, the spy has to be among Henry, Bob, or Diana, so for the next team I’d like to keep Grace and myself and avoid having more than one of those three on it.

From my perspective the fail on Mission 2 points squarely at either Henry or Diana, since I know I’m good. I’m happy keeping Alice and Grace together and would prefer a team that includes at most one of Henry/Diana, ideally with me on it so we can test that pool.

I’m on board with keeping Alice and Grace, since they’re the only two who’ve been on a clean team together so far, and I’d lean toward adding just one of Henry/Diana plus someone new like Frank or Eve so we don’t gamble on that whole Mission 2 core again.

I’m fine anchoring around Alice and Grace too, and given Mission 2’s single fail I’d rather bench Henry this round and try something like Alice, Grace, Bob, and Frank to see if the problem was in that previous core.

I like anchoring on Alice and Grace too, and I’d rather leave both Henry and Diana off this one and try something like Alice, Grace, Bob, and either Frank or me so we get a fresh read without that Mission 2 core.

From where I’m sitting, Alice and Grace look like the safest anchors, and I’d much rather avoid that Mission 2 core for now and try something like Alice, Grace, Bob, and me. If that passes clean, we’ve basically isolated the problem to Henry/Diana, which helps everyone going forward.

I’m happy to anchor around Alice and myself, and I’d prefer we avoid the Mission 2 core by running something like Alice, me, Bob, and Frank this round. If that passes clean, it strongly points the blame at Henry/Diana for the earlier fail.

I’m fine with Alice and Grace as anchors, but I really don’t like how quickly the table has coalesced around auto‑including Frank. I’d rather see Alice, Grace, and two from Bob/Charlie/Eve (with me sitting if that makes people more comfortable) than locking in Frank on this one.

proposals.reasoning: We’re down 1–2, so we must minimize spy risk while still using the best info we have. Table consensus has strongly coalesced around a Henry + Grace core (the only fully clean mission was Henry–Alice–Grace), and most players also agree on excluding Bob and Frank because Bob is the only player on both failed teams and Frank appears only on a fail with Bob. I’m including myself (Charlie) and Eve as completely fresh picks with no mission history, which avoids reusing the exact same failing combinations and diluting spy density across the team. For the last slot, I’m choosing Alice over Diana: if Bob is the common spy on missions 2 and 3, then Alice is consistent with being good on all three missions so far, whereas adding Diana reintroduces another person from the failed second mission without the same upside of prior clean association from mission 1. This team: (1) follows the widely supported Henry + Grace core, (2) hard-excludes the most suspicious pair Bob and Frank, and (3) fills out with Charlie, Eve, and Alice as the lowest-risk combination given mission outcomes and table discussion.

votes.comment: Bob is the only player on both failed missions and is off this team, Frank is also off, and the only fully clean mission was Henry–Grace–Alice. Adding two fresh players (Charlie, Eve) without prior fail history makes this the lowest-risk lineup given existing info.

I know I’m good and any consistent spy set then forces at least one of Alice, Henry, or Grace to be evil; this team includes all three, so it cannot be guaranteed clean and is very likely to contain at least one spy.
Best balance of info and risk: keeps the widely suspected Bob/Frank off, uses the only fully clean core (Henry+Grace), and fills with mostly fresh/consistent picks (Charlie, Eve, Alice).
Fits the Henry+Grace core I trust, excludes Bob and Frank who look worst from the fails, and adds mostly fresh or previously clean players, so this seems like our safest shot right now.
I’m on the team as the only evil; passing this gives me a clean shot to sabotage and win the game.
This team almost certainly has only one spy (Eve) on a mission that needs 2 FAILs, so it’s very likely to succeed and move good to 2–2; I want a team with higher spy density.

Team keeps the Henry+Grace core, excludes the highly suspicious Bob/Frank pair, and adds only new players Charlie and Eve plus Alice, who fits well with the most likely spy worlds. This seems as safe as we’re likely to get right now.
Team has three confirmed-good to me (Henry, Alice, Grace) and avoids the two known bad patterns (Diana, Frank, Bob), leaving at most one unknown spy among Charlie/Eve—about as safe as we can get.

discussion.content: Given the two single-fail missions, Bob is the only person who was on *both* of them, so I really don’t want him on this team; I’m most comfortable building around Henry and Grace from the clean first mission and adding people who haven’t shown up on a failed team yet.

I get that I’m on both failed teams, but both only had *one* fail, which means the spy could just as easily be Alice, Henry, Grace, or Frank; I still trust Henry from mission 1, but I think we should avoid reusing the exact same cores and bring in people who haven’t been on fails yet, like Diana or Eve.

I really don’t want Bob on this team given he’s the only one on both fails, and I’d like us to anchor around Henry plus either Diana or Grace, then fill the last spots with people who haven’t been on a failed mission yet like Eve (and I’m happy to go too).

I’m strongly in favor of a Henry + Grace core, and I’d really like us to keep both Bob and Frank off this team; something like Henry, Grace, Charlie, Eve, and either me or Alice feels a lot safer than reusing the people tied to both failed missions.

I’m on board with a Henry + Grace core, and I’d really like us to keep Bob and Frank off this one; something like Henry, Grace, Charlie, Diana, and me feels like a solid mix that doesn’t double down on the people tied to both failed missions.

I’m fine with a Henry + Grace core, but I don’t think we should auto-clear everyone else from the failed teams—between Alice, Bob, and even Charlie pushing hard narratives, I’d rather mix in at least one person who hasn’t been “protected” by the table yet, like Eve or Diana, and avoid locking in any one story as fact.

Given Bob’s on both failed teams and I know I’m good from the first success with Henry, I’m most comfortable with a core of Henry + me and then adding Charlie, Diana, and Eve. I’d really like to keep Bob and Frank off this mission if we can.

I’m happy with a Henry + Grace core, and I like adding Charlie and Eve as fresh faces; for the last spot I slightly prefer Alice over Diana or Bob given how mission 2 went, so I’d lean toward Henry, Grace, Charlie, Eve, and Alice.
